description: Returns the description for the specified stack; if no stack name was specified, then it returns the description for all the stacks created. For more information about a stack's event history, see Understand CloudFormation stack creation events in the CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that's associated with the stack, which aren't always interchangeable: Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID. Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

nested_items.name: Stacks
nested_items.description: A list of stack structures.

nested_items.name: StackId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier of the stack.

nested_items.name: StackName
nested_items.description: The name associated with the stack.

nested_items.name: ChangeSetId
nested_items.description: The unique ID of the change set.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A user-defined description associated with the stack.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: A list of Parameter structures.

nested_items.name: ParameterKey
nested_items.description: The key associated with the parameter. If you don't specify a key and value for a particular parameter, CloudFormation uses the default value that's specified in your template.

nested_items.name: ParameterValue
nested_items.description: The input value associated with the parameter.

nested_items.name: UsePreviousValue
nested_items.description: During a stack update, use the existing parameter value that the stack is using for a given parameter key. If you specify true, do not specify a parameter value.

nested_items.name: ResolvedValue
nested_items.description: Read-only. The value that corresponds to a Systems Manager parameter key. This field is returned only for Systems Manager parameter types in the template. For more information, see Specify existing resources at runtime with CloudFormation-supplied parameter types in the CloudFormation User Guide.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the stack was created.

nested_items.name: DeletionTime
nested_items.description: The time the stack was deleted.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The time the stack was last updated. This field will only be returned if the stack has been updated at least once.

nested_items.name: RollbackConfiguration
nested_items.description: The rollback triggers for CloudFormation to monitor during stack creation and updating operations, and for the specified monitoring period afterwards.

nested_items.name: RollbackTriggers
nested_items.description: The triggers to monitor during stack creation or update actions.
To use the rollback triggers previously specified for this stack, if any, don't specify this parameter.

nested_items.type: for example, when creating the stack or during a previous stack update
nested_items.description: To specify new or updated rollback triggers, you must specify all the triggers that you want used for this stack, even triggers you've specified before (for example, when creating the stack or during a previous stack update). Any triggers that you don't include in the updated list of triggers are no longer applied to the stack.
To remove all currently specified triggers, specify an empty list for this parameter.

nested_items.name: MonitoringTimeInMinutes
nested_items.description: The amount of time, in minutes, during which CloudFormation should monitor all the rollback triggers after the stack creation or update operation deploys all necessary resources.

nested_items.name: StackStatus
nested_items.description: Current status of the stack.

nested_items.name: StackStatusReason
nested_items.description: Success/failure message associated with the stack status.

nested_items.name: DisableRollback
nested_items.description: Boolean to enable or disable rollback on stack creation failures:
true: disable rollback.
false: enable rollback.

nested_items.name: NotificationARNs
nested_items.description: Amazon SNS topic Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to which stack related events are published.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TimeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: The amount of time within which stack creation should complete.

nested_items.name: Capabilities
nested_items.description: The capabilities allowed in the stack.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Outputs
nested_items.description: A list of output structures.

nested_items.name: OutputKey
nested_items.description: The key associated with the output.

nested_items.name: OutputValue
nested_items.description: The value associated with the output.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: User defined description associated with the output.

nested_items.name: ExportName
nested_items.description: The name of the export associated with the output.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that's associated with the stack. During a stack operation, CloudFormation uses this role's credentials to make calls on your behalf.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: A list of ``Tag``s that specify information about the stack.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Required. A string used to identify this tag. You can specify a maximum of 128 characters for a tag key. Tags owned by Amazon Web Services have the reserved prefix: aws:.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Required. A string containing the value for this tag. You can specify a maximum of 256 characters for a tag value.

nested_items.name: EnableTerminationProtection
nested_items.description: Whether termination protection is enabled for the stack.

nested_items.name: ParentId
nested_items.description: For nested stacks---stacks created as resources for another stack---the stack ID of the direct parent of this stack. For the first level of nested stacks, the root stack is also the parent stack.

nested_items.name: RootId
nested_items.description: For nested stacks---stacks created as resources for another stack---the stack ID of the top-level stack to which the nested stack ultimately belongs.

nested_items.name: DriftInformation
nested_items.description: Information about whether a stack's actual configuration differs, or has drifted, from its expected configuration, as defined in the stack template and any values specified as template parameters. For more information, see Detect unmanaged configuration changes to stacks and resources with drift detection.

nested_items.name: StackDriftStatus
nested_items.description: Status of the stack's actual configuration compared to its expected template configuration.
DRIFTED: The stack differs from its expected template configuration. A stack is considered to have drifted if one or more of its resources have drifted.
NOT_CHECKED: CloudFormation hasn't checked if the stack differs from its expected template configuration.
IN_SYNC: The stack's actual configuration matches its expected template configuration.
UNKNOWN: This value is reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: LastCheckTimestamp
nested_items.description: Most recent time when a drift detection operation was initiated on the stack, or any of its individual resources that support drift detection.

nested_items.name: RetainExceptOnCreate
nested_items.description: When set to true, newly created resources are deleted when the operation rolls back. This includes newly created resources marked with a deletion policy of Retain.

nested_items.name: DeletionMode
nested_items.description: Specifies the deletion mode for the stack. Possible values are:
STANDARD - Use the standard behavior. Specifying this value is the same as not specifying this parameter.
FORCE_DELETE_STACK - Delete the stack if it's stuck in a DELETE_FAILED state due to resource deletion failure.

nested_items.name: DetailedStatus
nested_items.description: The detailed status of the resource or stack. If CONFIGURATION_COMPLETE is present, the resource or resource configuration phase has completed and the stabilization of the resources is in progress. The stack sets CONFIGURATION_COMPLETE when all of the resources in the stack have reached that event. For more information, see Understand CloudFormation stack creation events in the CloudFormation User Guide.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If the output exceeds 1 MB in size, a string that identifies the next page of stacks. If no additional page exists, this value is null.
